Plot taxonomic stats on a ggraph tree

Source: R/taxatree_plot.R
taxatree_plot.Rd

Uses ggraph. See tree-development vignette.

taxatree_plot(
  graph_object,
  layout_coords,
  size_stat = "taxon_mean",
  colour_stat = "b_mu",
  max_node_size = 8,
  max_edge_width = max_node_size - 2,
  sig_var = "p_mu",
  sig_threshold = 0.05,
  sig_stroke_width = 1.5,
  colour_palette = "Green-Brown",
  reverse_colours = FALSE,
  luminance_l2 = 80,
  colour_lims = c(-2, 2)
)

Arguments

graph_object

tidygraph made with taxatree_nodes taxatree_edges
layout_coords

dataframe of x and y coordinates
size_stat

name of variable to scale size of nodes and edges (natural log scale)
colour_stat

name of variable to scale colour/fill of nodes and edges (natural log scale)
max_node_size

set this to avoid overlapping nodes at different scales
max_edge_width

max edge width (optionally relative to max node size)
sig_var

name of variable used to define statistical significance (outlines significant nodes) - NULL for none
sig_threshold

value of sig_var below which statistical significance outlines are drawn
sig_stroke_width

fixed width of statistical significance node outlines
colour_palette

any diverging hcl colour palette name see: colorspace::hcl_palettes("diverging", n = 7, plot = TRUE)
reverse_colours

reverse direction of colour scale?
luminance_l2

luminance of colourscale midpoint (higher is lighter)
colour_lims

limits of colour and fill scale, used to harmonise across several plots (values squished to fit this range!)

Value

ggraph ggplot

Examples

#
